Title.Text: Multi-Service Law Firm in Manchester, UK

Subtitle.Text: MCR Solicitors provides expert legal services in UK Immigration, Family Law, Personal Injury, and more. Our Manchester-based team of qualified solicitors is here to help you navigate complex legal matters with professionalism and care.

Content.Html:
UK Visas & Immigration Solicitors

We at MCR Solicitors (Manchester) provide a wide range of UK visas & immigration services to businesses and individuals including UK work visas, UK visitor visas, family visas, student visas, Indefinite Leave to Remain (ILR) and British citizenship etc.

Divorce & Family Law Solicitors

MCR Solicitors recognise the difficulties and complexities of modern society and the impact that they can have upon family life. This can be a worrying and stressful time, whether it's because of a relationship breakdown, separation or divorce, or perhaps a dispute concerning your children.

Personal Injury Claims

Our expert personal injury solicitors in Manchester have vast experience in handling personal injury compensation claims on behalf of people across the UK. Making a personal injury compensation claim is straightforward with MCR Solicitors in Manchester. We will help you from start to finish and will remain committed to achieving the best result.

Our experienced team of solicitors and legal professionals are dedicated to providing the highest quality legal services.

Our highly experienced UK immigration solicitors in Manchester deal with all types of UK visas and immigration applications. We're authorised and regulated by the Solicitors Regulation Authority (SRA), so you know you're in safe hands.

Work Visas UK

  • Skilled Worker Visa
  • Health And Care Worker
  • Graduate Visa (PSW)

  • Innovator Visa

  • Marriage Visitor Visa
  • Family Visitor Visa

UK immigration & visa application checking service is for those who are completing their visa application but need legal advice about application & documents. Get your UK immigration application checked by an Immigration solicitor before submitting to the Home Office.

If you have completed your application form successfully but would like a second set of eyes to check the application, this will give you that extra assurance. This service is targeted to those clients, who have a basic understanding of the Immigration law and the application process but require assistance with some aspects of the application, or assurance that the relevant information has been included.

Our service covers a range of applications for entry clearance, extending your stay, permanent residence or naturalisation as a British Citizen. Our solicitors can provide you with an expert opinion on your application before submitting to the Home Office.

Address: 5 Stockport Road, Manchester, M19 3AB

Phone: 0161 466 1280

Email: info@mcrsolicitors.co.uk

Opening Hours: Monday - Friday: 9:00 AM - 5:30 PM

MetaTitle.Text: Skilled Worker Visa UK - MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: The UK Skilled Worker visa allows overseas skilled workers to come to or stay in the UK to do an eligible job with a Home Office approved employer.

MetaKeywords.Text: skilled worker visa uk, tier 2 visa, uk work visa, immigration solicitors manchester

Subtitle.Text: Work in the UK with an approved employer

Content.Html:
The UK Skilled Worker visa allows overseas skilled workers to come to or stay in the UK to do an eligible job with an approved employer. You must have a confirmed job offer in a UK company that holds a sponsorship license.

The Skilled Worker Visa is open to individuals of all nationalities (except British and Irish) who have an offer of an eligible skilled job in the UK from a Home Office approved sponsor.

The route can lead to settlement and applicants can be joined by dependent partners and children.

Skilled Worker visa has replaced the Tier 2 (General) work visa category from 1 December 2020.

Skilled Worker visa requirements

In order to qualify for a Skilled Worker Visa, you will need to satisfy UK Visas and Immigration that:

  • You have a valid Certificate of Sponsorship for the job you are planning to do
  • Your job offer is a genuine vacancy
  • Your sponsor has paid any required Immigration Skills Charge
  • Your job is at an appropriate skill level
  • You are competent in the English language to at least CEFR Level B1 (equivalent to IELTS 4.0)
  • You will be paid a salary that equals or exceeds both a general salary threshold and the 'going rate' for the occupation
  • You have enough money to support yourself without relying on public funds
  • You have provided a criminal record certificate if required

If you want to apply for a Skilled Worker visa UK to do an eligible job with an approved employer in the UK then our UK immigration solicitors can help.

MetaTitle.Text: Health and Care Worker Visa UK - MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Health and Care Worker visa for medical professionals to work in the NHS or adult social care in the UK.

MetaKeywords.Text: health and care worker visa, nhs visa uk, medical professional visa, immigration solicitors manchester

Subtitle.Text: Work in the NHS or adult social care

Content.Html:
The Health and Care Worker visa is open for medical professionals such as qualified doctors, and nurses to come to or stay in the UK to do an eligible job with the NHS, as an NHS supplier or in adult social care.

The Health and Care visa is part of the Skilled Worker visa. You must meet the requirements of the Skilled Worker visa in addition to the requirements set out in this guidance to be eligible for the Health and Care visa.

Health and Care Worker visa requirements

To qualify for a Health and Care Worker visa, you must:

  • be a qualified doctor, nurse, health professional or adult social care professional
  • work in an eligible health or social care job
  • work for a UK employer that's been approved by the Home Office
  • have a 'certificate of sponsorship' from your employer with information about the role you've been offered in the UK
  • be paid a minimum salary - how much depends on the type of work you do

You must have a confirmed job offer before you apply for your visa.

MetaTitle.Text: Minister of Religion Visa UK - MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Minister of Religion visa (T2) allows you to work within a faith community in the UK as a minister, missionary or religious order member.

MetaKeywords.Text: minister of religion visa, t2 religious worker visa, faith community visa uk

Subtitle.Text: Work within a faith community in the UK

Content.Html:
The Minister of Religion visa (T2) allows you to come to or stay in the UK if you've been offered a job within a faith community (for example as a minister of religion, missionary, or member of a religious order) in the UK.

Minister of Religion (T2) visa requirements

You need to:

  • have a certificate of sponsorship for your job
  • prove your knowledge of English
  • have personal savings so you can support yourself when you arrive in the UK
  • show you can travel and your travel history over the last 5 years
  • have tuberculosis test results if you're from a listed country

MetaTitle.Text: International Sportsperson Visa UK - MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: International Sportsperson visa for elite sportspersons and qualified coaches to work in the UK.

MetaKeywords.Text: international sportsperson visa, sports visa uk, athlete visa, coach visa uk

Subtitle.Text: Visa for elite sportspersons and coaches

Content.Html:
You can apply for an International Sportsperson visa if all of the following apply:

  • you're an elite sportsperson or qualified coach, who's recognised by your sport's governing body as being at the highest level of your profession internationally
  • your sport's governing body is endorsing your application
  • your employment will develop your sport in the UK at the highest level
  • you meet the other eligibility requirements

This visa has replaced the Sportsperson (T2) visa and the sporting part of the Temporary Worker - Creative and Sporting visa (T5).

Eligibility requirements

You need to:

  • have a valid certificate of sponsorship for your job
  • usually prove that you can speak and understand English, if you're applying to stay for longer than 12 months
  • have personal savings so you can support yourself when you arrive in the UK
  • show you can travel and your travel history over the last 5 years

MetaTitle.Text: Graduate Visa UK - MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Graduate visa allows international students to stay in the UK and work for 2-3 years after completing their degree.

MetaKeywords.Text: graduate visa uk, post study work visa, international student visa, immigration solicitors manchester

Subtitle.Text: Work in the UK after completing your studies

Content.Html:
The Graduate route provides an opportunity for international students who have been awarded their degree to stay in the UK and work or look for work, at any skill level for two years, or three years for doctoral students.

The Graduate route is unsponsored, meaning you do not need a job offer to apply for the route. You will be able to work flexibly, switch jobs, and develop your career in the UK as required. The work can be in any sector and at any level without any minimum salary requirements or the need for visa sponsorship.

Students studying on a Student visa will need to make an application in the UK to be granted permission under the route after the successful completion of their degree.

Any Student having a valid leave to remain as a student who has completed an eligible qualification can apply for switching into the Graduate route from 1 July 2021.

Graduate visa requirements

You can apply for a visa under the Graduate route if all of the following are true:

  • you're in the UK
  • your current visa is a Student visa or Tier 4 (General) student visa
  • you studied a UK bachelor's degree, postgraduate degree, or other eligible course for a minimum period of time with your Student visa or Tier 4 (General) student visa

MetaTitle.Text: Youth Mobility Scheme Visa UK - MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Youth Mobility Scheme visa for young adults aged 18-30 from participating countries to live and work in the UK for up to 2 years.

MetaKeywords.Text: youth mobility scheme visa, tier 5 youth visa, working holiday visa uk

Subtitle.Text: Experience life in the UK for up to 2 years

Content.Html:
The Youth Mobility Scheme visa is for young adults from participating countries and territories who wish to experience life in the United Kingdom for a period of up to two years.

Dependants are not eligible to apply on the Youth Mobility Scheme visa route and it is not a route that leads directly to indefinite leave to remain in the UK.

This visa has replaced the Youth Mobility Scheme visa (T5).

Youth Mobility Scheme visa requirements

You can apply for a Youth Mobility Scheme visa if you:

  • want to live and work in the UK for up to 2 years
  • are aged 18 to 30
  • have 2,530 in savings
  • have certain types of British Nationality or are from certain countries or territories

MetaTitle.Text: Student Visa UK - Study in the UK | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Student visa for international students who wish to study in the UK. Point-based visa category for studying at UK educational institutions.

MetaKeywords.Text: student visa uk, study visa uk, tier 4 visa, international student visa

Subtitle.Text: Study at a UK educational institution

Content.Html:
The Student visa category is for those international students who wish to study in the UK and have been offered a place on a course in the UK. A student visa is a point-based category and points are awarded for Certificate of Acceptance for Studies (CAS) and Funds for Maintenance.

You can apply for a student visa to study in the UK if you are 16 or over and you are from a country that's not in the European Economic Area (EEA) or Switzerland. If you are outside the UK, you can apply for entry clearance as a Student from your country of nationality by submitting an entry clearance application to the British Embassy or High Commission.

MetaTitle.Text: Child Student Visa UK | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Child Student visa for children aged 4-17 to study at an independent school in the UK.

MetaKeywords.Text: child student visa uk, tier 4 child visa, independent school visa uk

Subtitle.Text: Study at an independent school in the UK

Content.Html:
You can apply for a Child Student visa if you're between 4 and 17 years old and you want to study at an independent school in the UK.

You must:

  • have an unconditional offer of a place on a course at an independent school
  • be able to show you'll have access to enough money to support you in the UK and pay for your course
  • have the consent of your parent or guardian to study in the UK - you'll need to prove this when you apply

If you're 18 or over, apply for a Student visa instead.

This visa has replaced the Tier 4 (Child) student visa.

MetaTitle.Text: Student Visa Extension UK | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Extend your student visa to continue your studies in the UK. Expert immigration advice from Manchester solicitors.

MetaKeywords.Text: student visa extension uk, extend tier 4 visa, student visa renewal

Subtitle.Text: Extend your stay to continue your studies

Content.Html:
You may be able to extend your Student visa to stay longer and continue your course or study a new course. This includes if you currently have a Tier 4 (General) student visa.

You must apply before your current visa expires. You can stay in the UK until you get a decision on your application.

MetaTitle.Text: Student Visitor Visa UK | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Short-term study visa for courses up to 6 months in the UK. Expert immigration advice from Manchester solicitors.

MetaKeywords.Text: student visitor visa uk, short term study visa, 6 month study visa uk

Subtitle.Text: Short-term study in the UK

Content.Html:
A Student Visitor visa allows you to study a short course in the UK for up to 6 months. This is ideal for language courses, training courses, or other short educational programmes.

You cannot work, extend this visa, or switch to another visa type from within the UK.

MetaTitle.Text: Switching to Student Visa UK | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Switch to a Student visa from another visa category in the UK. Expert immigration advice from Manchester solicitors.

MetaKeywords.Text: switch to student visa uk, change visa to student, student visa switch

Subtitle.Text: Change your visa to study in the UK

Content.Html:
You may be able to switch to a Student visa from within the UK if you're currently on certain other visa types. You must have a valid Confirmation of Acceptance for Studies (CAS) from a licensed sponsor.

Some visa categories do not allow switching to a Student visa from within the UK. Contact our immigration solicitors for advice on your specific situation.

MetaTitle.Text: Standard Visitor Visa UK | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: UK Standard Visitor visa for short-term stays up to 6 months for tourism, business, or visiting family and friends.

MetaKeywords.Text: standard visitor visa uk, uk tourist visa, uk visit visa

Subtitle.Text: Visit the UK for tourism, business or family

Content.Html:
You need to apply for a UK Standard Visitor visa if you want to visit the UK for a short-term stay (up to 6 months) for tourism, business, or to see your family and friends.

UK Standard Visitor visa requirements

You must show that:

  • you'll leave the UK at the end of your visit
  • you're able to support yourself and your dependants during your trip
  • you're able to pay for your return or onward journey
  • you'll not live in the UK for extended periods through frequent visits

MetaTitle.Text: Marriage Visitor Visa UK | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Marriage Visitor visa to get married or register a civil partnership in the UK.

MetaKeywords.Text: marriage visitor visa uk, wedding visa uk, civil partnership visa

Subtitle.Text: Get married or form a civil partnership in the UK

Content.Html:
The Marriage Visitor visa allows you to come to the UK to get married or register a civil partnership. You can stay for up to 6 months.

After your wedding or civil partnership, you must leave the UK. You cannot switch to a family visa from within the UK on this visa type.

MetaTitle.Text: Family Visitor Visa UK | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Visit family members in the UK with a Family Visitor visa.

MetaKeywords.Text: family visitor visa uk, visit family uk, uk family visit visa

Subtitle.Text: Visit your family in the UK

Content.Html:
A Family Visitor visa allows you to visit your family members in the UK for a short stay up to 6 months.

You must demonstrate that you have genuine reasons to visit and will return to your home country at the end of your visit.

MetaTitle.Text: Business Visitor Visa UK | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Business Visitor visa for attending meetings, conferences, and business activities in the UK.

MetaKeywords.Text: business visitor visa uk, uk business visa, conference visa uk

Subtitle.Text: Attend meetings and business activities in the UK

Content.Html:
A Business Visitor visa allows you to visit the UK for business-related activities such as attending meetings, conferences, training sessions, or negotiations.

You cannot work or receive payment from a UK company while on this visa.

MetaTitle.Text: Child Visitor Visa UK | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Child Visitor visa for children under 18 visiting the UK.

MetaKeywords.Text: child visitor visa uk, children visit visa uk, minor visitor visa

Subtitle.Text: Visit the UK as a child under 18

Content.Html:
A Child Visitor visa is for children under 18 who want to visit the UK. Additional requirements apply for children traveling without a parent or legal guardian.

You must show appropriate care arrangements are in place for the child during their stay in the UK.

MetaTitle.Text: Innovator Visa UK | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Innovator visa for experienced businesspeople to set up an innovative business in the UK.

MetaKeywords.Text: innovator visa uk, uk business visa, entrepreneur visa uk

Subtitle.Text: Start an innovative business in the UK

Content.Html:
The Innovator visa is for experienced businesspeople who want to set up or run an innovative business in the UK. Your business idea must be endorsed by an approved body.

The Innovator visa can lead to settlement in the UK after 3 years.

MetaTitle.Text: Start-up Visa UK | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Start-up visa for first-time entrepreneurs to set up an innovative business in the UK.

MetaKeywords.Text: start-up visa uk, startup visa, entrepreneur visa uk

Subtitle.Text: Launch your first business in the UK

Content.Html:
The Start-up visa is for first-time entrepreneurs who want to set up an innovative business in the UK. Your business idea must be endorsed by an approved body.

You can stay for up to 2 years and then switch to an Innovator visa.

MetaTitle.Text: Global Talent Visa UK | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Global Talent visa for leaders or potential leaders in academia, research, arts, culture, or digital technology.

MetaKeywords.Text: global talent visa uk, tier 1 exceptional talent, tech visa uk

Subtitle.Text: For leaders in academia, arts, or digital technology

Content.Html:
The Global Talent visa is for leaders or potential leaders in academia and research, arts and culture, or digital technology. You must be endorsed by a recognized UK body.

This visa can lead to settlement in the UK.

MetaTitle.Text: UK Expansion Worker Visa | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: UK Expansion Worker visa for senior managers or specialist employees setting up a UK branch of an overseas business.

MetaKeywords.Text: uk expansion worker visa, sole representative visa, overseas business uk

Subtitle.Text: Set up a UK branch of your overseas business

Content.Html:
The UK Expansion Worker visa is for senior managers or specialist employees being sent to the UK to set up a UK branch of an overseas business.

Your employer must have a sponsor licence and issue you with a certificate of sponsorship.

MetaTitle.Text: ILR Long Residence 10 Year Route | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Apply for Indefinite Leave to Remain after 10 years continuous lawful residence in the UK.

MetaKeywords.Text: ilr 10 year route, long residence ilr, indefinite leave to remain

Subtitle.Text: Settle in the UK after 10 years continuous residence

Content.Html:
You may qualify for Indefinite Leave to Remain (ILR) if you have lived in the UK continuously and lawfully for 10 years. This is known as the long residence route.

You must demonstrate continuous lawful residence without significant breaks from the UK.

MetaTitle.Text: ILR as a Spouse | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Apply for Indefinite Leave to Remain as the spouse or partner of a British citizen or settled person.

MetaKeywords.Text: ilr spouse visa, spouse settlement uk, partner ilr

Subtitle.Text: Settle in the UK as a spouse or partner

Content.Html:
You can apply for ILR as a spouse or partner of a British citizen or settled person after completing 5 years on the spouse/partner visa route.

You must meet the English language requirement and pass the Life in the UK test.

data.DisplayText: ILR as a Parent of British Child
data.Author: [js: parameters('AdminUsername')]

TitlePart.Title: ILR as a Parent of British Child

MetaTitle.Text: ILR as a Parent of British Child | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Apply for Indefinite Leave to Remain as the parent of a British citizen child.

MetaKeywords.Text: ilr parent british child, parent visa ilr, settlement parent visa

Title.Text: ILR as a Parent of British Child

Subtitle.Text: Settle in the UK as the parent of a British child

Content.Html:
You can apply for ILR as the parent of a British citizen child after completing 5 years on the parent route.

You must demonstrate ongoing involvement in your child's life and meet the English language and Life in the UK test requirements.

MetaTitle.Text: ILR as a Skilled Worker | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Apply for Indefinite Leave to Remain after 5 years on the Skilled Worker visa route.

MetaKeywords.Text: ilr skilled worker, tier 2 ilr, work visa settlement

Subtitle.Text: Settle in the UK through the Skilled Worker route

Content.Html:
You can apply for ILR after completing 5 years on the Skilled Worker visa (formerly Tier 2 General).

You must meet the salary threshold, pass the Life in the UK test, and meet the English language requirement.

MetaTitle.Text: ILR as a Bereaved Partner | MCR Solicitors

MetaDescription.Text: Apply for Indefinite Leave to Remain if your British partner or spouse has passed away.

MetaKeywords.Text: ilr bereaved partner, bereaved spouse visa, widow visa uk

Subtitle.Text: Settlement for bereaved partners

Content.Html:
If you are on a spouse/partner visa and your British partner or spouse passes away, you may be eligible to apply for ILR immediately.

Special provisions apply to bereaved partners to provide security during a difficult time.
